profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded in NoteTab Pro. Encoded by Elizabeth Carron. 2014-10-28

did.head: Collection Overview
did.abstract: Contains photograph albums and memorabilia books of Adrienne Auerswald from her time as a Smith College student.

bioghist.p: Adrienne Aurswald was born in Tulsa, Oklahoma, and lived there with her parents until she entered the music program at Smith College in 1939. While at Smith, she lived in Jordan House and was a Junior Usher, a member of the Glee Club, and the Vocational Guidance Chairman.

Auerswald graduated in 1943 and moved to New York City to study with Quena Mario, the soprano for the Metropolitan Opera. There, she perfected her Italian vocal style. In 1951, Auerswald returned to Tulsa to perform with the Tulsa Opera and Tulsa Philharmonic Orchestra. She opened a voice studio which she ran until returning to Smith College to teach in 1957. In 1962, Auerswald earned her Master's degree and became a faculty member.

Auerswald continued to perform at Smith and in various local opera productions. She was the Dean of the Class of 1968, the chair of the Music Department twice, sat on the Development Council and the Alumnae Council. In 1984 she was named the Iva Dee Hiatt Professor of Music. In 1987, Auerswald retired to focus on her private voice studio. She died in Northampton, Massachusetts, in 2008.

scopecontent.p: The collection contains four memorabilia books and one photo album related to Adrienne Auerswald's time as a student. The memorabilia books are very detailed, containing news clippings, correspondence, programs, drawings, poetry, and pressed flowers from her time as a prospective student through to her senior year.

accessrestrict.p: The records are open for research according to the regulations of the Smith College Archives without any additional restrictions.

userestrict.p: Single photocopies may be made for research purposes. Permission to publish material from the documents must be requested from the Smith College Archives. Smith College owns copyright to any published material relating to college events and activities. Provenance and copyright ownership of other materials is unknown and researchers are responsible for determining any question of copyright.

prefercite.p: Please use the following format when citing materials from this collection:
Adrienne Auerswald Papers, Box #665.1, Smith College Archives

acqinfo.p: The Adrienne Auerswald Papers were donated to the College Archives.

processinfo.p: Originally processed by Madison White, Class of 2016. Revisions by Elizabeth Carron.
